Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Postoperative Analgesia Modalities after Cesarean Section

Trial_Design.evidence: A network meta-analysis of 110 randomised controlled trials involving 8871 pregnant women was conducted.

Intervention.evidence: Intrathecal morphine (IM) and epidural morphine had the best analgesic effect.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to identify the optimal analgesic method.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time to first postoperative request for analgesia.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: All modalities except wound infiltration prolonged the time to first analgesia request.
